sections.heading: こ-そ-あ-ど System
sections.content:
The こ-そ-あ-ど system is a fundamental pattern in Japanese for demonstratives (this/that) and question words (which/what). The prefixes こ-, そ-, あ-, and ど- combine with various suffixes to create words for things, places, directions, people, and more.

これ/それ/あれ/どれ "this/that/that over there/which" ここ/そこ/あそこ/どこ "here/there/over there/where" この/その/あの/どの "this/that/that/which" (+ noun)

children.heading: こ- (Near speaker)
children.content: Close to me Within my reach Here (my area) "This/here"

children.heading: そ- (Near listener)
children.content: Close to you Within your reach There (your area) "That/there"

children.heading: あ- (Far from both)
children.content: Away from both Over there Distant location "That over there"

children.heading: ど- (Question)
children.content: Which one? Where? What kind? Question prefix

children.heading: Things (れ)
children.content: これ "this (thing)" それ "that (thing)" あれ "that (thing) over there" どれ "which (thing)" Standalone pronouns

children.heading: Noun modifiers (の)
children.content: この "this" (+ noun) その "that" (+ noun) あの "that" (+ noun) どの "which" (+ noun) Before nouns この本 "this book"

children.heading: Places (こ)
children.content: ここ "here" そこ "there" あそこ "over there" どこ "where" Location words

children.heading: Direction (ちら)
children.content: こちら "this way/direction" そちら "that way/direction" あちら "that way over there" どちら "which way" Direction/polite

children.heading: People (の人/いつ/なた)
children.content: この人 "this person" その人 "that person" あの人 "that person" どの人 "which person" Or use: こいつ/そいつ/あいつ/どいつ (rough)

children.heading: Manner/kind (んな)
children.content: こんな "this kind of" そんな "that kind of" あんな "that kind of" どんな "what kind of" Type/manner

children.heading: Degree (れだけ/れほど/れくらい)
children.content: これだけ "this much" それだけ "that much" あれだけ "that much" どれだけ "how much" Quantity/degree

children.heading: これ/それ/あれ/どれ (Things)
children.content: これは本です "This is a book" それを買う "Buy that" あれは何？ "What's that over there?" どれがいい？ "Which is good?" Standalone objects

children.heading: この/その/あの/どの (Modifiers)
children.content: この本 "This book" その人 "That person" あの山 "That mountain" どの道 "Which road" Before nouns always

children.heading: ここ/そこ/あそこ/どこ (Places)
children.content: ここに来て "Come here" そこで待つ "Wait there" あそこに行く "Go over there" どこにいる？ "Where are you?" Location words

children.heading: こちら/そちら/あちら/どちら (Direction/Polite)
children.content: こちらへどうぞ "This way, please" そちらは寒いですか "Is it cold there (where you are)?" あちらに見えます "You can see it over there" どちらがいいですか "Which is better?" (polite) Direction + polite reference

children.heading: こんな/そんな/あんな/どんな (Kind/Type)
children.content: こんな本 "This kind of book" そんなこと "That kind of thing" あんな人 "That kind of person" どんな映画 "What kind of movie" Type/manner/degree

children.heading: Visual representation
children.content: Speaker → こ (here with me) ↓ Listener → そ (there with you) ↓ Far away → あ (over there) Spatial relationship

children.heading: Practical example
children.content: In a room: これ (in my hand) それ (on your desk) あれ (across the room) Physical distance matters

children.heading: こちら/そちら/あちら
children.content: More polite than ここ/そこ/あそこ こちらは田中です "This is Tanaka" (introducing) そちらの天気はどうですか "How's the weather there?" Polite direction/reference

children.heading: Same prefix = same distance
children.content: これ + ここ + この + こんな All refer to near speaker それ + そこ + その + そんな All refer to near listener あれ + あそこ + あの + あんな All refer to far from both Pattern is consistent

children.heading: Systematic questions
children.content: どれ "which (thing)" どこ "where" どの "which" (+ noun) どちら "which (of two)/where" どんな "what kind of" どう "how" どうして "why" どのくらい "how much/long" All use ど- prefix

children.heading: 〜はどうですか
children.content: 天気はどうですか "How's the weather?" 日本語はどうですか "How is Japanese?" Asking opinion/state

children.heading: こんな/そんな/あんな + noun
children.content: こんな本が好き "I like this kind of book" そんなことない "That's not true" あんな人は嫌い "I hate that kind of person" Type/manner

children.heading: それで (And so/Therefore)
children.content: 雨だった。それで家にいた。 "It was raining. So I stayed home." Connector Not demonstrative

children.heading: Time references
children.content: この前 "the other day/before" その時 "at that time" あの時 "at that time (memorable)" どの時 "which time" Time + demonstrative

sections.heading: これら/それら/あれら (Plural)
sections.content: これらの本 "These books" それらは高い "Those are expensive" あれらの人々 "Those people over there" Plural demonstratives Formal/written mainly

children.heading: この/その/あの人 (Person reference)
children.content: この人は友達です "This person is my friend" あの人は誰？ "Who is that person?" Polite person reference Better than pronouns

children.heading: こいつ/そいつ/あいつ (Rough "guy")
children.content: こいつは面白い "This guy is funny" あいつは誰？ "Who's that guy?" Very casual/rough Males mainly Can be rude

children.heading: Using これ/それ/あれ before nouns
children.content: Wrong: これ本 ⚠️ Correct: この本 ✓ "This book" Use この/その/あの before nouns

children.heading: Confusing ここ and これ
children.content: Wrong: これに行く ⚠️ Correct: ここに行く ✓ "Go here" ここ = place これ = thing

children.heading: Wrong distance choice
children.content: Context matters: Speaker holds apple → これ Listener holds apple → それ Apple on far table → あれ Choose based on actual distance

sections.heading: Conversation Perspective Shift
sections.content: A: これは何？ "What's this?" (near A) B: それは辞書だよ "That's a dictionary" (near A, so それ for B) Speaker's こ = listener's そ Perspective changes

children.heading: Basic question patterns
children.content: どれですか "Which one is it?" どこに行く？ "Where are you going?" どんな人？ "What kind of person?" どうしたの？ "What happened?" ど- for all questions

children.heading: Basic
children.content: これは何ですか "What is this?" ここに来てください "Please come here" この本は面白い "This book is interesting" どこに行きますか "Where are you going?" こんな時に "At a time like this"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: System in use: A: これは何ですか。 B: それは私のかばんです。 A: "What is this?" B: "That's my bag." この店はどこにありますか。 あそこに見えます。あの大きい 建物です。 "Where is this store? You can see it over there. It's that big building." どんな映画が好きですか。 こんな面白い映画が好きです。 "What kind of movies do you like? I like interesting movies like this." そちらの天気はどうですか。 こちらは雨です。そちらも 雨ですか。 "How's the weather there? It's raining here. Is it raining there too?"
